required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Using CP-751,871 In Patients With Stage IV Colorectal Cancer That Has Not Responded To Previous Anti-Cancer Treatments
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Single Arm Study Of CP-751,871 In Patients With Refractory Metastatic Adenocarcinoma Of The Colon Or Rectum

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test if there is any survival benefit in patients with refractory metastatic colorectal cancer that receive CP-751, 871.

primary_outcome.measure: Estimate of the 6 Month Survival Probability
primary_outcome.description: The 6 month survival probability was defined as the probability of survival at 6 months based on the Kaplan-Meier estimate. The time was from date of enrollment to date of death due to any cause. For participants who were last known to be alive, overall survival was censored at the last contact date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until death or censorship, up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: The time from date of enrollment to date of death due to any cause. For participants who were last known to be alive, overall survival was censored at the last contact date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until tumor progression or censorship, up to 33 months. The frequency of tumor assessments was screening, every cycle, end of treatment (within 28 days of last dose of study drug), and follow-up.
secondary_outcome.description: The period from study entry until disease progression. Participants without progression or death were censored at time of last disease assessment. Progression is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0), as 20% increase in the sum of longest diameters of target measurable lesions, or a clear increase in a non-target lesion, or the apprearance of new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every cycle (Day 15-21 or according to local standard), end of treatment (within 28 days of last dose of study drug) and follow-up (150 days after last dose of study drug), up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target and non-target disease. PR applied only to participants with at least one measurable lesion. Greater than or equal to 30 % decrease under baseline of the sum of longest diameters of all target measurable lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Descriptive Summary of Figitumumab Concentration Versus Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1, 1 hour after end of infusion (post-dose) on Day 2 in Cycle 1, pre-dose on Day 1 in Cycles 2,3,4, 1 hour post-dose on Day 1 in Cycle 5
secondary_outcome.description: The measurement of mean plasma concentration of figitumumab in Day 1 of Cycle 1,2,3,4,5

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Reporting Positive for Total Anti-drug Antibodies (ADA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 hours prior to infusion in Cycles 1 and 4, at the end of treatment, and at the 4th scheduled follow-up visit (~150 days after the last infusion)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of figitumumab in terms of producing an antidrug antibody (ADA) response were monitored.

secondary_outcome.measure: Counts of Circulating Tumor Cells (CTCs) Expressing Positive Insulin-like Growth Factor 1 Receptor (IGF-1R)
secondary_outcome.description: The quantification of circulating tumor cells (CTCs) expressing the IGF-1R in this patient population. Blood samples were collected, and were measured using an automated microscope system.
The quantification of circulating tumor cells (CTCs)in this patient population. Blood samples were collected, and were measured using an automated microscope system.

intervention.description: Human IgG2 Monoclonal Antibody. 20mg/kg or 30 mg/kg every 3 weeks for 17 cycles, until progression or unacceptable toxicity develops.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have stage IV colorectal cancer
- Patients whose disease has worsened despite prior anti-cancer therapy
- Patients who have satisfactory bonemarrow, kidney and liver function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are being simultaneously treated with another anti-cancer therapy.
- Patients who have previously received anti-cancer therapy that works like CP-751, 871 (targets insulin-like growth factor receptor)
- Patients that are pregnant or breast-feeding

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab (CP-751,871) was given in 3-week cycles for a total of up to 17 cycles. Participants can receive treatment beyond 17 cycles provided clinical benefit is being achieved. Figitumumab 20 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) was administered as an intravenous (IV) infusion on Day 1 and 2 in Cycle 1 (loading dose), and on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter.

group.title: Figitumumab 30 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab (CP-751,871) was given in 3-week cycles for a total of up to 17 cycles. Participants can receive treatment beyond 17 cycles provided clinical benefit is being achieved. Figitumumab 30 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) was administered as an IV infusion on Day 1 and 2 in Cycle 1 (loading dose), and on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: The 6 month survival probability was defined as the probability of survival at 6 months based on the Kaplan-Meier estimate. The time was from date of enrollment to date of death due to any cause. For participants who were last known to be alive, overall survival was censored at the last contact date.

measure.title: Estimate of the 6 Month Survival Probability
measure.description: The 6 month survival probability was defined as the probability of survival at 6 months based on the Kaplan-Meier estimate. The time was from date of enrollment to date of death due to any cause. For participants who were last known to be alive, overall survival was censored at the last contact date.

analysis.groups_desc: The hypotheses for each group were H0:p=0.45 vs H1:p>0.45. There was one interim analysis for futility for each group based on the method of Case and Morgan. The futility boundary was not crossed for 20/kg mg group, but was crossed for the 30/kg mg group. It was recommended to investigators that participants be discontinued from treatment with 30 mg/kg of figitumumab.
analysis.p_value_desc: The final analysis was intended to be a binomial test (death prior to 6 months, yes or no). However, 2 participants in the 30/kg mg group were censored prior to 6 months, so the six month Kaplan and Meier estimates were used for each group instead.
analysis.method: Test of probability of 6 month survival
analysis.method_desc: p-Value >0.05 applies to each group (20 mg/kg and 30 mg/kg). Greenwood's formula was used for standard deviation.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target and non-target disease. PR applied only to participants with at least one measurable lesion. Greater than or equal to 30 % decrease under baseline of the sum of longest diameters of all target measurable lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every cycle (Day 15-21 or according to local standard), end of treatment (within 28 days of last dose of study drug) and follow-up (150 days after last dose of study drug), up to 33 months
outcome.population: Per protocol. All enrolled participants who started treatment, with measurable disease and adequate baseline assessment.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab (CP-751,871) was given in 3-week cycles for a total of up to 17 cycles. Participants can receive treatment beyond 17 cycles provided clinical benefit is being achieved. measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target and non-target disease. PR applied only to participants with at least one measurable lesion. Greater than or equal to 30 % decrease under baseline of the sum of longest diameters of all target measurable lesions.
measure.population: Per protocol. All enrolled participants who started treatment, with measurable disease and adequate baseline assessment.

outcome.title: Descriptive Summary of Figitumumab Concentration Versus Time
outcome.description: The measurement of mean plasma concentration of figitumumab in Day 1 of Cycle 1,2,3,4,5
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1, 1 hour after end of infusion (post-dose) on Day 2 in Cycle 1, pre-dose on Day 1 in Cycles 2,3,4, 1 hour post-dose on Day 1 in Cycle 5
outcome.population: All participants for whom PK was assessed at least once. The numbers of participants analyzed are numbers of observation (non-missing concentrations). The numbers for 20 mg/kg group are 84,7,3,2,13 for five cycles, respectively. The numbers for 30 mg/kg group are 79,8,2,2,8 for five cycles, respectively.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab (CP-751,871) was given in 3-week cycles for a total of up to 17 cycles. Participants can receive treatment beyond 17 cycles provided clinical benefit is being achieved. measure.title: Descriptive Summary of Figitumumab Concentration Versus Time
measure.description: The measurement of mean plasma concentration of figitumumab in Day 1 of Cycle 1,2,3,4,5
measure.population: All participants for whom PK was assessed at least once. The numbers of participants analyzed are numbers of observation (non-missing concentrations). The numbers for 20 mg/kg group are 84,7,3,2,13 for five cycles, respectively. The numbers for 30 mg/kg group are 79,8,2,2,8 for five cycles, respectively.

outcome.title: Participants Reporting Positive for Total Anti-drug Antibodies (ADA)
outcome.description: The immunogenicity of figitumumab in terms of producing an antidrug antibody (ADA) response were monitored.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 hours prior to infusion in Cycles 1 and 4, at the end of treatment, and at the 4th scheduled follow-up visit (~150 days after the last infusion)
outcome.population: Participants for whom at least one ADA measurement was done. The outcome was not analyzed and only listing of ADA level for each participant was available.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab (CP-751,871) was given in 3-week cycles for a total of up to 17 cycles. Participants can receive treatment beyond 17 cycles provided clinical benefit is being achieved. measure.title: Participants Reporting Positive for Total Anti-drug Antibodies (ADA)
measure.description: The immunogenicity of figitumumab in terms of producing an antidrug antibody (ADA) response were monitored.
measure.population: Participants for whom at least one ADA measurement was done. The outcome was not analyzed and only listing of ADA level for each participant was available.

outcome.title: Counts of Circulating Tumor Cells (CTCs) Expressing Positive Insulin-like Growth Factor 1 Receptor (IGF-1R)
outcome.description: The quantification of circulating tumor cells (CTCs) expressing the IGF-1R in this patient population. Blood samples were collected, and were measured using an automated microscope system.
outcome.population: All enrolled participants who started treatment and who have at least one sample submitted. The total number of participants for this outcome measure was less than the original population. "N" means the numbers of units analyzed in Pre-treatment and/or Baseline, and Post-Baseline and/or Follow-up, respectively.

reported_events.time_frame: Includes date up to 150 days after last dose of study drug
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
